summary: Amazon.com Inc. has purchased 822,234 shares ofAdvanced Micro Devices Inc. worth $84.4 million . The strategic investment comes as AMD continues to gain momentum in the data center and AI chip markets . AMD recently reported first-quarter revenue of $7.44 billion .  AMD projects second-quarter revenue around $7.4 billion, surpassing analyst forecasts . The company projects $800 million in inventory-related charges tied to new export regulations . The Trump administration is reportedly considering revisions to AI export controls, potentially shifting toward a global licensing system . AmazonAMZN delivered strong first-quarter 2025 results with earnings of $1.59 per share . Net sales reached $155.7 billion, up 9% from the previous year and slightly ahead of expectations . Despite this solid performance, the e-commerce giant's stock faced pressure following the earnings announcement due to its cautious second-quarter outlook .  The Zacks Consensus Estimate for 2025 earnings is pegged at $6.3 per share, which indicates a jump of 13.92% from the year-ago period . The retail sector faces significant challenges with tariffs on Chinese imports, creating ambiguity about pricing strategies and potential impacts on consumer demand .  Amazon Web Services (“AWS) continues to be a highlight, growing 17% year over year to reach a $117 billion annualized revenue run rate . Everyday essentials grew twice as fast as the rest of its business in the first quarter, representing one-third of all units sold in the United States .  Amazon has expanded access to its Nova foundation models through nova.amazon.com . The company also introduced Amazon Nova Act, a new AI model trained to perform actions within web browsers . Nova Act outperforms competitors on several internal tests, scoring 94% on ScreenSpot Web Text .  AMZN has underperformed both the broader Zacks Retail-Wholesale sector and the S&P 500 . Shares of Microsoft have returned 4.2% while Alphabet and Nvidia have declined 19.1% and 12.3% in the same time .  Despite strong fundamental performance, Amazon's valuation metrics raise questions about near-term upside potential . The company's forward 12-month Price-to-Sales ratio of 2.79X stands significantly higher than the Zacks Internet - Commerce industry average of 1.86X . For investors already holding Amazon shares, maintaining positions seems prudent .  Amazon's diversified business model, growing high-margin revenue streams, and strategic investments in future technologies suggest that the company remains well-positioned for long-term growth despite current headwinds and intensifying competition in the AI space . AMZN currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold)  This article was originally published by Zacks Investment Research . In the U.S. shares of this article, please share your thoughts with us at http://www.zacks.com/news/zacksacksacks/2013/2014 .

Amazon.com experienced a 8% increase in its share price over the last month . The recent positive market trend, with tech stocks climbing alongside Bitcoin's surge past $100,000, aligned with Amazon's strong earnings report . Meanwhile, broader investor optimism driven by major trade deals likely underpinned the gains seen in Amazon's stock .  Analysts forecast Amazon's revenue to grow annually by 9.4% and profit margins to rise to 12.2% within three years . The company's initiatives, such as the collaboration with Amplitude and AWS expansion in Chile, may strengthen its market position .  Analysts expect earnings to grow to US$102 billion by April 2028 . Despite a current share price of US$187.39, analysts have set a consensus price target at US$244.28 . The advance in Amazon's strategic capabilities amid influential partnerships could align with these targets, providing context to recent price adjustments .  Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned . Companies discussed in this article include NasdaqGS:AMZN and Nasdaq GS: AMZN .

Amazon.com Services LLC violated federal labor law in multiple cases at a Staten Island, N.Y., warehouse . The company and Amazon Labor Union have been at odds since the warehouse workers won a historic election vote for union representation in 2022 and were later certified by NLRB .  Workers have what are known as “Weingarten rights,” which allow them to have representatives present in disciplinary hearings . This violated the National Labor Relations Act, which protects workers’ right to self-organize, bargain collectively .  Judge Green dismisses allegations that Amazon similarly violated the law in its suspension and discharge of another worker involved in union activity . “ultimately, there was nothing suspicious about the timing of [the worker’s] suspension, discharge,” he said .

Amazon was struggling before mixed second-quarter results, but it has several attractive growth opportunities . Mounting competition for Keytruda doesn't significantly alter Merck's long-term prospects . Even when equities are volatile, investors can find great stocks to buy .  Amazon Web Services (AWS) continues to grow rapidly . In the first quarter, net sales increased by 9% year over year to $155.7 billion . AWS revenue jumped by 17% to $29.3 billion .  Amazon Pharmacy is managing to disrupt an industry that large and well-established businesses have long dominated . Its advertising unit is yet another high-margin, high-growth opportunity . The company's massive ecosystem of more than 200 million Prime members grant it significant monetization potential .  Merck's woes predate the current economy . The company's biggest drug, cancer medicine Keytruda, could soon get more competition . Its biggest would-be competitor is ivonescimab, a medicine being developed in the U.S. bySummit Therapeutics .  Keytruda has had time to rack up an impressive number of indications -- it has over 30 in the U.S. in 2014 . It took the medicine until 2022 -- eight long years -- to serve one million patients . Merck is working on a subcutaneous version of it that will extend its patent life and help drive top-line growth .  Merck might not be performing well right now, but the company could deliver excellent results to investors . It has a juicy yield of 3.9%, compared to theS&P 500's 1.3%, and it has raised its payouts by 80% in the past 10 years . Amazon is releasing a new generative AI-powered tool to help sellers update listings with missing details or attributes . The tool automatically suggests product titles, attributes, descriptions, and missing details to sellers based on seasonal trends . Sellers can accept, reject, or modify these suggestions before updating the listing in Amazon's catalog .  Amazon said that over 900,000 sellers have used its generative AI tools to date . The company added that over 90% of the time merchants accept AI-generated content without any edits . Google,eBay,Meta, andShopify have released multiple tools in this category .  tool-is-designed-to-enhance-product-listings/http://://://www.tool.org/tool-Is-Design-To-Extend-Product-Listings// .

AI and advertising are dodging the impact of President Trump’s tariffs, while consumer-focused companies like Apple take the hit . Google parent Alphabet (GOOG,GOOGL), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), and Microsoft all scored solid results .  Apple warned that it will take a $900 million charge in its current quarter . CEO Tim Cook also noted the outlook for the June quarter remains murky . It's a sign that Big Tech's cloud and AI giants are navigating the current economic environment with relative ease .  Alphabet’s advertising revenue topped expectations in Q1 . Analysts weren’t concerned, as the company, like its rivals, is contending with more AI demand than it can handle .  The de minimis exemption exempted shipments of $800 or less coming into the US from tariffs . Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said it's difficult to tell where tariffs will go from here .  Meta will not be immune should there be a macro slowdown, analyst Ralph Schackart wrote . Apple also has to worry about the Trump administration’s Section 232 investigation into potential semiconductor tariffs .  How Cook ultimately decides to handle the ongoing tariff situation will have a major impact on the company going forward . While his contemporaries are contending with their own tariff troubles, the stakes are far higher for Apple .

Amazon Web Services (AWS) plans to establish its first data centre region in Chile . The new South America (Chile) Region is expected to be operational by the second half of 2026 . This marks the company’s third cloud region in Latin America, following existing regions in Brazil and Mexico .  Chile region will be designed to be sovereign-by-design, maintaining the AWS Cloud's long-standing architectural principle . Amazon aims to achieve net-zero carbon by 2040 and has designed the region to be largely air-cooled .  Ocelot is a prototype quantum computing chip designed to slash costs by 90% . The chip was developed by the AWS Center for Quantum Computing at the California Institute of Technology .

Don't be put off by the lethargic, recent performance of Chevron's shares . Kroger may be one of the market's best investment prospects hiding in plain sight . BYD is one of Berkshire Hathaway's least likely yet most promising holdings .  Buffett first established his position in 2020 at the height of the COVID-19 pandemic . The National Center for Energy Analytics doesn't expect the planet's need for crude to peak until at least 2030 . Even then we'll still need plenty of it for at least a few more decades .  Chevron is the industry's third-biggest, as measured by market capitalization . It takes a major player like Chevron to bring enough leverage and scale to the table to make drilling worthwhile . The company's forward-looking dividend yield stands at just under 5% .  High-margin private label goods are now a major part of the company's business mix . Kroger Plus now counters Amazon's continued penetration of the grocery market . The e-commerce giant added grocery delivery to its mix of online shopping options .  An investment in Kroger stock has outperformed theS&P 500 for the past five-year, 20-year and 30-year stretches . Berkshire Hathaway's 50 million share position is presently worth $3.6 billion .  China's BYD delivered a world-leading 4.27 million hybrids and EVs last year . The company's recent headwind is largely the result of CEO Elon Musk's affiliation with the White House .  Berkshire's position in BYD isn't huge thanks to a bit of selling last year and the year before . Buffett mostly just didn't want to compete with a then-well-performing Tesla -- a concern that's since been dialed back . BYD stands to remain a leader of this growing market . Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin rocket company scored a $2.4 billion contract from the US Space Force to loft military satellites into space . The award was a coup for Bezos and showed it was finally playing in the same league as Elon Musk's SpaceX . Musk, his longtime rival, has the ear of President Donald Trump .  The Trump administration’s proposed budget would cut NASA funding by 24% and potentially kill a moon mission Blue Origin is building a lander for . SpaceX is also looking to influence the regulator governing Amazon.com's Project Kuiper satellite internet service . “Elon has both feet inside the door and is calling the shots,” says Bill Goodman, the chief executive officer of .  Bezos has adopted a lower profile even as tech executives like Mark Zuckerberg have continued to visit the White House and lobby Trump directly . Amazon donated $1 million to Trump’s inauguration, where Bezos mingled with the chiefs of Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet .  As recently as last spring, Bezos was doing little to ingratiate himself with Trump . Some associates are betting disagreements with the administration over trade and immigration will eventually break up the bromance .  Musk has funneled hundreds of millions of dollars into the Trump campaign . The billionaire owns X, the social media platform he owns, to enthusiastically endorse Trump for a second term . Bezos arranged a call with Trump to recommend Doug Burgum as a vice presidential candidate .  Bezos has been a space nerd since boyhood . He founded Blue Origin in 2000, with a goal of lowering the cost of space exploration by creating reusable rockets . Musk had similar aspirations when he founded SpaceX about two years later .  Bezos devotes as much as 10 hours a day to meetings at Blue Origin . He's rarely sighted at Seattle headquarters these days, and prefers to keep in touch with executives by phone . Bezos has sought to impose discipline on the company and build a credible rival to SpaceX .  Blue Origin has filed at least two protests seeking to overturn federal contracts with SpaceX . In the last 11 years, SpaceX has won as much as $25 billion in US government contracts to Blue Origin’s roughly $6 billion .  Blue Origin is determined to demonstrate its bona fides with the Artemis program, NASA’s planned mission to return people to the Moon . But Musk has long seen Mars as a worthier goal and has routinely showed up at Trump events wearing an “Occupy Mars” t-shirt .  Isaacman pledged not to abandon the agency’s multibillion-dollar Moon push and send astronauts to Mars instead . He said he hadn’t been in contact with Musk about his plans to manage the agency . The administration's proposed budget would add $1 billion for Mars .  Amazon is struggling to build satellites quickly enough to meet the deadline . The company will probably have to seek an extension from the Federal Communications Commission . SpaceX suggested that the agency stop granting extensions for satellite operators .  Bezos will have to carefully tend his relationship with Trump . Goodman recommends that he look for opportunities where Blue Origin can work with SpaceX and show Trump and Musk that his main goal is to help advance space exploration . The S&P 500 delivered a return of 25% (including dividends) last year, but had you invested in the VOOG instead, you would have earned a much higher return of 35.9% . The Vanguard ETF is down slightly more than the S.P 500 this year but I predict it will recover and beat the index again in 2025 . Last year's result wasn't a one-off because the Vanguard ETF has outperformed the index every year .  Nvidia is the largest holding in the Vanguard S&P 500 Growth ETF . Nvidia grew its revenue by 114% during its last fiscal year, and its stock more than doubled in both 2023 and 2024 .  Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon just reported their financial results for the first quarter of 2025 . Each company exceeded Wall Street's expectations at the top and bottom line . Their cloud computing segments continued to deliver rapid growth, led by soaring demand for artificial intelligence (AI) services .  The Vanguard S&P 500 Growth ETF has delivered a compound annual return of 15.4% since it was established in 2010 . The high-growth segments of the stock market were trading at elevated valuations heading into President Trump's "Liberation Day" tariff announcements .  President Trump has already paused the more aggressive "reciprocal tariffs" he imposed on America's trading partners . Many of the products sold by the top holdings in the Vanguard ETF aren't affected by tariffs . Semiconductors are exempt, for example, much to the benefit of companies like Nvidia andBroadcom .  Tech giants are likely to hold up better than the rest of the market because of the composition of their product portfolios, their enormous scale, and their strong balance sheets . As a result, I think there is a very high chance the Vanguard S&P 500 Growth ETF recovers to beat the S.P 500 yet again in 2025 .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is893% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to162% for the S&P 500 . If you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $695,897!  The Magnificent Vanguard Index Fund will beat the S&P 500 again in 2025, says The Motley Fool . Amazon reported a phenomenal first quarter, but the market is worried about guidance and tariffs . Management explained why it's optimistic about the tariff situation . Amazon stock trades at a low price-to-earnings multiple, but it's already up from recent lows . If you look down the road a few years, this dip looks like an excellent buying opportunity .  Earnings per share rose from $0.98 last year to $1.59 this year, easily beating Wall Street's expectation . But the market got hung up on second-quarter guidance . Management is guiding for sales to increase 9% year over year but for a potential decrease in operating income .  Jassy didn't whitewash the potential effects of tariffs on the first-quarter earnings call . He said that so far, demand has not attenuated, and there has been a streak of higher buying in some categories . Amazon is one of the largest grocers in the world, selling $100 billion in groceries last year .  Amazon Web Services (AWS) revenue increased 17% year over year in the first quarter . It's seeing growth both from generative artificial intelligence (AI) business as well as non-generative AI business .  Amazon stock fell after earnings, but its P/E ratio has remained steady around 30 . That means the market thinks Amazon is fairly valued at this price, and the negativity is built into the stock price . With management's encouraging stance on tariffs and plenty of long-term opportunities, the stock might start to climb back up soon . Warren Buffetthas spent decades sizing up the world's sharpest business minds . Buffett has openly admired fellow top-ranking billionaire Bezos for years . While he didn't invest in Amazon early, Buffett never underestimated Bezos' rare genius .  Buffett called Bezos "the most remarkable business person of our age" Bezos has "shown an amazing talent" by taking everyday things people already bought and "figuring out a way to make people happier buying those products," Buffett said . Buffett: "I can't think of another example like it"  Berkshire Hathaway purchased its first Amazon shares in early 2019 . Buffett even admitted he underestimated Amazon's potential . Buffett clarified that the buy wasn't his idea but came from a younger investment manager .  Jeff Bezos would be No. 1 at $2.25 per share, Warren Buffett says . Warren Buffett praises Jeff Bezos as 'Most Remarkable Business Person'
